  • Constructor Details

    • TableTabController

      public TableTabController()

  • Method Details

    • addTableCol

      public void addTableCol​(java.lang.String displayName, java.lang.String propertyName)
      Adds a column to the main table with the mentioned display and property names, taken from the record class.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The name to be used as the column header. Can be whatever you fancy.
      propertyName - The name of the attribute in the record class. This needs to match but doesn't seem to be case-sensitive. This hooks up to a get[propertyName] method and uses the output to fill in the column. Can work with at least strings and bools.

    • addTableColCheck

      public void addTableColCheck​(java.lang.String displayName, javafx.scene.control.TableColumn col)
      Creates a checkbox in the panel below the main table, and binds it to its column's visibility.
      Parameters:
      displayName - The String to be used as a label for the checkbox
      col - The column object whose visibility will be bound by the checkbox

    • toggleAllTableCols

      public void toggleAllTableCols()
      Runs through any checkboxes in the checkbox area, and sets their selected attribute to that of the toggle button. Relies on the binding established in addTableColCheck.

    • addRecordsToTable

      public void addRecordsToTable​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> records)
      Adds all record objects in an arraylist to the main viewing table. Does not add anything to the database.
      Parameters:
      records - An ArrayList of record objects to be displayed in the table

    • addRecordsToTable

      public void addRecordsToTable​(Record rec)
      Adds a record object to the main viewing table. Does not add anything to the database.
      Parameters:
      rec - A record object to be displayed in the table

    • setTableRecords

      public void setTableRecords​(java.util.ArrayList<Record> records)
      Sets the record objects displayed in table to those contained in an arraylist. Does not alter the database.
      Parameters:
      records - An ArrayList of record objects to be displayed in the table

    • getDisplayedRecords

      public java.util.ArrayList<Record> getDisplayedRecords()
      Returns an arraylist of all the record objects in the table.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all record objects in the table.

    • setParentController

      public void setParentController​(MainController mainController)
      Stores a reference to the parent controller, in this case mainController.
      Parameters:
      mainController - a reference to the main controller

    • refreshTableData

      public void refreshTableData() throws java.sql.SQLException, java.io.IOException
      Heavy-handed method of refreshing the table's data - reloads everything from the database with filters applied. This is required to view new or changed records, but not to see records deleted.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.io.IOException

    • analyseCrimeLocationDifference

      public void analyseCrimeLocationDifference()
      Shows a popup with the difference in location between two crimes if two were selected, else shows an error message.

    • analyseCrimeTimeDifference

      public void analyseCrimeTimeDifference()
      Shows a popup with the difference in time between two crimes if two were selected, else shows an error message.
